byline.contributor: Donatella Lorch, a former New York Times foreign correspondent, is a freelance writer based in Kathmandu.

abstract: Reporter's Notebook; writer Donatella Lorch describes changed atmosphere in Kathmandu and surrounding area of Nepal as residents deal with fears and anxieties caused by series of large earthquakes and aftershocks; says unpredictability of quakes is driving force in unease.
lead_paragraph: After the magnitude 7.8 earthquake struck on April 25, life for the people of Kathmandu has become one of nervous hyper-vigilance over when the next one might hit.

headline.main: Uncertainty and Helplessness Become a Way of Life in Nepal
headline.print_headline: Uncertainty and Helplessness Become a Way of Life in Nepal

snippet: After the magnitude 7.8 earthquake struck on April 25, life for the people of Kathmandu has become one of nervous hyper-vigilance over when the next one might hit.
